sub_title: Architecture / Interior design / Urban Planning / Project Management

awards.title: FLUX
awards.description:
Entry for a competition called ‘Amphibious living’, that had the focus on living in ‘inhabitable’ areas: the wetlands of rivers and coastline. In our proposition we chosse for the most extreme conditions, a tidal sea in the north of the Netherlands. this everchanging landscape puts its force on the design for a self-sufficient living-space. The waves and the tide produce the energy, and also influence both shape and orientation of the flexible structure.
Rewarded with 2nd prize, 2001.

awards.title: Prix de Rome 2001; longlisted
awards.description:
Entry for this competition, which is bi-annually and alternating for architects and artists. In the south of the city of Amsterdam, a part of the ‘Berlage’ city-planning is virtually open for a new building, with specific programmatic content. It must include a theater, library and a bathing-house. To get the local, islamic neighbourhood more involved, a space for praying is integrated; a sphere in the box, which hardly fits in. In the roof a slice, in the direction of Mecca, is made to let sunlight in.
http://escribo.me/competitions/prix-de-rome-2002.html

projects.title: Architect / Project Manager at UNSOS, Mogadishu, Somalia
projects.description:
Architect / Project manager for the United Nations Support Office for Somalia (UNSOS). Projects include:
- (Re)design of a masterplan for the basecamp in Somalia, integrating infrastructure (roads, data, electricity, water, waste, etc.) with buildings for offices, housing, canteens and recreation, with an emphasis on physical and electronic security.
- Design and implementation for several facilities within the camp, like radio/cctv control rooms, acces control gates for vehicles and people, shooting range, buildings for offices and housing.
- Design and implementation for several (military) camps throughout Somalia.

contributors.headline: Architecture / Interior design / Urban Planning / Project Management
Retired bei United Nations

projects.title: Interior Design / Project Management for the EEBS, Addis Abeba, Ethiopia
projects.description:
Interior Architect / Project Manager for this EU funded 'Transformation Triggering Facilities' (TTF) project. This project included:
- Design and project management for the temporary premises of the Ethio-European Business School (EEBS) and Business Innovation Centre. 3000m2
Awaiting the construction of the new building for the EEBS, the desire to already start the courses during the coming 3 years lead to the quest for a temporary solution. In the nearly completed new premises of the School of Commerce, 4 floors were found suitable after my analysis. 
I initiated and lead the meetings with stakeholders, made and presented spatial proposals, furniture and infrastructure layouts with their cost implications.

projects.title: CLG Training Institute
projects.description: The aim of the masterplan for the Chalimbana Local Government Training Institute is to increase the quality of life of both students and academic staff of the Institute, to structure the campus for the long term and to gives a clear identity to individual places. The main orientation of all buildings is strictly east-west with the main façades (north & south) avoiding low-standing sun. Access to the campus by car remains on the existing road. A new main datum for pedestrian connection is established to form the heart of the campus. It spans between the mostly residential area in the north and the educational program in the south. The clusters of housing and education at the two opposite ends of the campus are surrounded by the lecturers houses, and leisure activities. Small neighbourhoods are formed by connecting some strips at the eastern end; the western buildings remain as strips and create courtyards by providing a terrace edge. For Cityfoerster.

projects.title: Belgian Embassy Bangkok, Thailand
projects.description:
Interior fit-out for the new Belgian Embassy in Bangkok, Thailand. Design, Supervision, Project Management, Cost Control. 920m2.
The Belgian Embassy in Bangkok, Thailand, has been relocated to the 17th floor of a newly constructed office building in the center of town, completed December 2011. Main reason for a new Embassy was a change in organization, and a wish for improving the efficiency, communication and representation. Floor area, 1000m2, remained the same. Using glazed separation walls, artwork and light fixtures by Belgian designers, the offices are a modern and pleasant working area. 
Completed September 2012.

projects.title: Belgian Embassy Kampala, Uganda
projects.description:
Interior fit-out for the new Belgian Embassy in Kampala, Uganda. Design, Supervision, Project Management, Cost Control. 600m2
The Belgian Embassy in Kampala, Uganda, has been relocated to the 6th, top floor of a newly constructed office building in the center of town, completed January 2012. Main reason for a new Embassy was to organise all the facilities on one floor, improving efficiency, communication and representation. Floor area, 600m2, remained the same. 
Using glazed separation walls, artwork and light fixtures by Belgian designers, the offices are a modern and pleasant working area. Completed March 2012.

contributors.headline: Architecture / Interior design / Urban Planning / Project Management

projects.title: Head Office Total E&P Kampala
projects.description:
Since the discovery of the oil reserves in the Great Lakes of Uganda, the global oil companies are eager to set foot on the ground. TOTAL, as one of the leading companies, are to establish their first Exploration and Production Head Office in Kampala. Within an existing building, 5 levels of office space (3500m2) are to be fitted out, to the highest international standards in terms of IT technology, design and artwork. An efficient, pleasant and diverse work environment is designed for an estimated 250 people, the pioneering staff. 
Completed February 2012.

contributors.headline: Architecture / Interior design / Urban Planning / Project Management

projects.title: Kingdom Kampala
projects.description:
Multi purpose development, in the center of Kampala, capitol of Uganda, Central Africa.
Next to the proposed 5 star hotel with convention center, a micro-city will be developed to suit the appropiate needs. Some figures:
55.000m2 of high standard office space, 45.000m2 of retail space, parking for over 1500 cars. 
A 5 storey plinth contains the main retail and parking, combined with art galleries On the roof of this a variety of luxury outdoor spaces wil be created: waterfalls, pools, terraces, gardens, kindergartens, beachclubs and patio’s.
Towering above this landscape, 4 fully glazed office towers are to be erected, all build in pairs, with different heights rising up to 13 storeys.
The fast emerging middle class of Ugandan society is the main target public, a new kind of inner city growth, first of its kind in Uganda, and most parts of East Africa.
Under construction, completion of total project expected to be in the year 2020.

profile_positions.title: Senior Project Leader

profile_positions.description: Eric Bos is founder of ESCRIBO Architects, based in The Hague in The Netherlands, and increasingly expanding its consultancy services internationally, with a focus on the African continent. He studied Industrial Design (BSc.) and Architecture (MSc.) at the Technical University Delft. By having worked for over 8 years on high density, inner-city housing projects mainly in The Netherlands, Eric has gained indepth knowledge about designing, implementing building techniques and supervising construction sites, which made him familiar with the process of building from first sketch until final completion. Over the years, other building types like schools, healthcare, offices etc. became increasingly important in his portfolio, and thus expanding his knowledge. Since 2010, Eric has alternating been living and working in The Netherlands, USA, Zambia, Ghana, Uganda, Togo, Benin, Ethiopia, Somalia and Thailand, being able to adapt to, and gaining knowledge of, local circumstances concerning building regulations and construction conditions.
